unit_learning_outcomes.description: Identify, describe and evaluate a broad range of aspects of Russian-speaking cultures and societies.
Demonstrate a refined awareness of language and language use, in both Russian and in English.
Identify, evaluate and deploy a broad range of grammatical structures of Russian at intermediate level.
Develop comprehensive intermediate level skills in reading, writing, listening and speaking in the Russian language.
Create meaningful intercultural encounters by applying relevant language conventions.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Students are expected to spend time on daily review of grammar and vocabulary, and language practice. Students should be familiar with and feel comfortable with each week’s content before starting a new week. Seminar preparation time also includes time to study, revise tutorial content and prepare for the quizzes and tests.

assessments.description: The purpose of the written examination is to check students’ knowledge of all aspects of grammar and vocabulary that they learn throughout the semester.
The purpose of the written test is to check students’ knowledge of all aspects of grammar and vocabulary that they learn.
The purpose of the written test is to check students’ knowledge of all aspects of grammar and vocabulary that they learn throughout the semester. Student will complete their final test online
Students have to demonstrate their knowledge and engagement with material explained during the semester via quizzes and other activities.

For the oral test, students have to prepare a three-minute talk on a topic of their choice. Students will be assessed on their presentation, as well as their ability to answer follow-up questions. This will be a part of regular seminar time. Online students will do this task via Zoom.

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 2, Attendance for exam only
Session 2, Special circumstances
Session 2, Weekday attendance, North Ryde

academic_org.value: Department of Media, Communications, Creative Arts, Language and Literature

data.description: This is an intermediate Russian unit, which is designed to further broaden students' knowledge of the Russian language. It provides various activities for developing Russian reading, comprehension, writing and speaking skills. The main aim of the unit is to improve students' ability to communicate in Russian in a variety of real-life situations and to understand and appreciate Russian culture, with a focus on vocabulary, and language fluency as well as on the grammatical accuracy of Russian.
data.title: C Russian Studies 4
